Pre-Game Insights: Gareth Southgate has fostered a club mentality, a sense of togetherness and team spirit.
Part of that has been a consistency of selection. The core of the group has largely remained the same since Euro 2020.
Southgate has already demonstrated that with the ruthless omission of Henderson — once one of his most trusted lieutenants — from his initial 33.
England aren’t going to Germany for a good time: they’re going there to win.
Post-Match Reflections: Southgate said, 'We knew this decision was looming. We’ve still felt we’ve been able to make better decisions in terms of injuries and availability by giving ourselves more time.'
Southgate also intimated that picking Shaw may have been what ruled out his club team-mate Maguire.
Southgate’s decisions made for a dramatic day. The hope will be that when the dust settles, the changes invigorate this group.
Southgate called upon his players to move beyond a difficult day in camp, starting with today’s friendly against Iceland.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England trained with 27 players on Thursday lunchtime.
Lewis Dunk, Luke Shaw and Maguire followed individual programmes as they sought to recover from injury.
Southgate is likely to select a front three of Kane, Bukayo Saka and Phil Foden.
The England manager, Gareth Southgate, has confirmed that Jack Grealish and Harry Maguire have been left out of the squad.
Others: The squad will face Iceland in a friendly match on Friday.
Southgate has emphasized the importance of bonding as a group and working together to achieve success in tournaments.
The England squad has some injury concerns, with Lewis Dunk and Luke Shaw not being fully available for the Iceland match.
Southgate has selected a squad with a mix of experience and youth, with some players having been with the team for a long time and others being new additions.
